   20: 
   21: -module(beam_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   24: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   25: 	 packed_registers/1, apply_last/1, apply_last_bif/1,
   26: 	 heap_sizes/1, big_lists/1, fconv/1,
   27:          select_val/1, select_tuple_arity/1,
   28:          swap_temp_apply/1, beam_init_yregs/1,
   29:          beam_register_cache/1]).
   30: 
   31: -export([applied/2,swap_temp_applied/1]).
   32: 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: -include_lib("syntax_tools/include/merl.hrl").
   35: 
   36: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   37: 
   38: all() -> 
   39:     [packed_registers, apply_last, apply_last_bif,
   40:      heap_sizes, big_lists, fconv,
   41:      select_val, select_tuple_arity,
   42:      swap_temp_apply, beam_init_yregs,
   43:      beam_register_cache].
   44: 
   45: groups() -> 
   46:     [].
   47: 
   48: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   49:     Config.
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   52:     ok.
   53: 
   54: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   55:     Config.
   56: 
   57: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: 
   61: 
   62: %% Verify that apply(M, F, A) is really tail recursive.
   63: apply_last(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   64:     Pid  = spawn(?MODULE, applied, [self(), 10000]),
   65:     Size =
   66: 	receive
   67: 	    {Pid, finished} ->
   68: 		stack_size(Pid)
   69: 	after 30000 ->
   70: 		ct:fail("applied/2 timed out.")
   71: 	end,
   72:     Pid ! die,
   73:     io:format("Size: ~p~n", [Size]),
   74:     if
   75: 	Size < 700 ->
   76: 	    ok;
   77: 	true ->
   78: 	    ct:fail("10000 apply() grew stack too much.")
   79:     end,
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: stack_size(Pid) ->
   83:     {heap_size, HS}=process_info(Pid, heap_size),
   84:     {stack_size,SS}=process_info(Pid, stack_size),
   85:     HS+SS.
   86: 
   87: applied(Starter, 0) ->
   88:     Starter ! {self(), finished},
   89:     receive
   90: 	die ->
   91: 	    ok
   92:     end,
   93:     ok;
   94: applied(Starter, N) ->
   95:     apply(?MODULE, applied, [Starter, N-1]).
   96: 
   97: %% Verify that tail-recursive use of apply(M,F,A) on a Bif works."
   98: apply_last_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   99:     apply(erlang, abs, [1]).
  100: 
  101: %% Test whether packing works properly.
  102: packed_registers(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  103:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  104: 
  105:     %% Generate scrambled sequence.
  106:     Seq0 = [{erlang:phash2(I),I} || I <- lists:seq(0, 260)],
  107:     Seq = [I || {_,I} <- lists:sort(Seq0)],
  108: 
  109:     %% Generate a test modules that uses get_list/3 instructions
  110:     %% with high register numbers.
  111:     S0 = [begin
  112: 	      VarName = list_to_atom("V"++integer_to_list(V)),
  113: 	      {merl:var(VarName),V}
  114: 	  end || V <- Seq],
  115:     Vars = [V || {V,_} <- S0],
  116:     NewVars = [begin
  117: 		   VarName = list_to_atom("M"++integer_to_list(V)),
  118: 		   merl:var(VarName)
  119: 	       end || V <- Seq],
  120:     MoreNewVars = [begin
  121:                        VarName = list_to_atom("MM"++integer_to_list(V)),
  122:                        merl:var(VarName)
  123:                    end || V <- Seq],
  124:     TupleEls = [?Q("id(_@Value@)") || {_,Value} <- S0],
  125:     S = [?Q("_@Var = id(_@Value@)") || {Var,Value} <- S0],
  126:     Code = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n"
  127: 	       "-export([f/0]).\n"
  128: 	       "f() ->\n"
  129:                "Tuple = id({_@TupleEls}),\n"
  130:                "{_@MoreNewVars} = Tuple,\n"
  131: 	       "_@S,\n"
  132: 	       "_ = id(0),\n"
  133: 	       "L = [_@Vars],\n"
  134: 	       "_ = id(1),\n"
  135: 	       "[_@NewVars] = L,\n"		%Test get_list/3.
  136: 	       "_ = id(2),\n"
  137: 	       "id([_@Vars,_@NewVars,_@MoreNewVars]).\n"
  138: 	       "id(I) -> I.\n"]),
  139: 
  140:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  141: 
  142:     %% Optionally print the generated code.
  143:     PrintCode = false,                          %Change to true to print code.
  144: 
  145:     case PrintCode of
  146:         false ->
  147:             ok;
  148:         true ->
  149:             merl:print(Code),
  150:             erts_debug:df(Mod),
  151:             {ok,Dis} = file:read_file(atom_to_list(Mod)++".dis"),
  152:             io:put_chars(Dis)
  153:     end,
  154: 
  155:     %% Executing the generated code in freshly spawned process makes it much
  156:     %% more likely to crash if there is a bug in init_yregs.
  157:     CombinedSeq = Seq ++ Seq ++ Seq,
  158:     CombinedSeq = spawn_exec(fun Mod:f/0),
  159: 
  160:     %% Clean up.
  161:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  162:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  163:     ok.
  164: 
  165: heap_sizes(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  166:     Sizes = erlang:system_info(heap_sizes),
  167:     io:format("~p heap sizes\n", [length(Sizes)]),
  168:     io:format("~p\n", [Sizes]),
  169: 
  170:     %% Verify that heap sizes increase monotonically.
  171:     Largest = lists:foldl(fun(E, P) when is_integer(P), E > P -> E;
  172: 				   (E, []) -> E
  173: 				end, [], Sizes),
  174: 
  175:     %% Verify that the largest heap size consists of
  176:     %%  - 31 bits of bytes on 32 bits arch
  177:     %%  - at least 52 bits of bytes (48 is the maximum virtual address)
  178:     %%    and at the most 63 bits on 64 bit archs
  179:     %% heap sizes are in words
  180:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  181: 	8 ->
  182: 	    0    = (Largest*8) bsr 63,
  183: 	    true = (Largest*8) > (1 bsl 52);
  184: 	4 ->
  185: 	    1 = (Largest*4) bsr 31
  186:     end,
  187:     ok.
  188: 
  189: %% Thanks to Igor Goryachev.
  190: 
  191: big_lists(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  192:     b(),
  193:     ok.
  194: 
  195: a() ->
  196:     {selected,
  197:      ["uid",
  198:       "nickname",
  199:       "n_family",
  200:       "n_given",
  201:       "email_pref",
  202:       "tel_home_number",
  203:       "tel_cellular_number",
  204:       "adr_home_country",
  205:       "adr_home_locality",
  206:       "adr_home_region",
  207:       "url",
  208:       "gender",
  209:       "bday",
  210:       "constitution",
  211:       "height",
  212:       "weight",
  213:       "hair",
  214:       "routine",
  215:       "smoke",
  216:       "maritalstatus",
  217:       "children",
  218:       "independence",
  219:       "school_number",
  220:       "school_locality",
  221:       "school_title",
  222:       "school_period",
  223:       "org_orgname",
  224:       "title",
  225:       "adr_work_locality",
  226:       "photo_type",
  227:       "photo_binval"],
  228:      [{"test"}]}.
  229: 
  230: b() ->
  231:     case a() of
  232:         {selected,
  233:          ["uid",
  234:           "nickname",
  235:           "n_family",
  236:           "n_given",
  237:           "email_pref",
  238:           "tel_home_number",
  239:           "tel_cellular_number",
  240:           "adr_home_country",
  241:           "adr_home_locality",
  242:           "adr_home_region",
  243:           "url",
  244:           "gender",
  245:           "bday",
  246:           "constitution",
  247:           "height",
  248:           "weight",
  249:           "hair",
  250:           "routine",
  251:           "smoke",
  252:           "maritalstatus",
  253:           "children",
  254:           "independence",
  255:           "school_number",
  256:           "school_locality",
  257:           "school_title",
  258:           "school_period",
  259:           "org_orgname",
  260:           "title",
  261:           "adr_work_locality",
  262:           "photo_type",
  263:           "photo_binval"],
  264:          _} ->
  265: 	    ok
  266:     end.
  267: 
  268: fconv(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  269:     do_fconv(atom),
  270:     do_fconv(nil),
  271:     do_fconv(tuple_literal),
  272:     3.0 = do_fconv(1.0, 2.0),
  273:     ok.
  274: 
  275: do_fconv(Type) ->
  276:     try
  277: 	do_fconv(Type, 1.0),
  278: 	ct:fail(no_badarith)
  279:     catch
  280: 	error:badarith ->
  281: 	    ok
  282:     end.
  283: 
  284: do_fconv(atom, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  285:     Float + a;
  286: do_fconv(nil, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  287:     Float + [];
  288: do_fconv(tuple_literal, Float) when is_float(Float) ->
  289:     Float + {a,b};
  290: do_fconv(A, B) when is_float(A), is_float(B) ->
  291:     A + B.
  292: 
  293: 
  294: select_val(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  295:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  296: 
  297:     %% Test select_val instructions around interesting powers of 2.
  298:     Powers = lists:seq(0, 33) ++
  299:         lists:seq(47, 49) ++
  300:         lists:seq(58, 65) ++
  301:         lists:seq(8192 - 5, 8192 + 5),
  302:     L = make_tests(Powers, 0, []),
  303:     Code = make_module(Mod, L),
  304:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  305: 
  306:     %% Uncomment the following line to print the generated code.
  307:     %%merl:print(Code),
  308: 
  309:     verify(L, Mod),
  310: 
  311:     %% Clean up.
  312:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  313:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  314: 
  315:     ok.
  316: 
  317: verify([{F,L}|T], Mod) ->
  318:     verify_1(L, F, Mod),
  319: 
  320:     Sum = lists:sum([abs(V) || {V,_} <- L]),
  321:     expect_error(Mod, F, -Sum),
  322:     expect_error(Mod, F, Sum),
  323:     expect_error(Mod, F, not_an_integer),
  324: 
  325:     verify(T, Mod);
  326: verify([], _Mod) -> ok.
  327: 
  328: verify_1([{V,Exp}|T], F, Mod) ->
  329:     case Mod:F(V) of
  330:         Exp ->
  331:             verify_1(T, F, Mod);
  332:         Other ->
  333:             io:format("~p:~p(~p) evaluates to ~p; expected ~p",
  334:                       [Mod,F,V,Other,Exp]),
  335:             ct:fail(unexpected_value)
  336:     end;
  337: verify_1([], _, _) -> ok.
  338: 
  339: expect_error(M, F, V) ->
  340:     try M:F(V) of
  341:         UnexpectedSuccess ->
  342:             io:format("~p:~p(~p) evaluates to ~p; expected it to fail",
  343:                       [M,F,V,UnexpectedSuccess]),
  344:             ct:fail(unexpected_success)
  345:     catch error:function_clause:Stk ->
  346:             [{M,F,[V],_}|_] = Stk
  347:     end.
  348: 
  349: make_tests([P|Ps], N0, Acc0) ->
  350:     {Acc,N} = make_tests_1(1 bsl P, N0, Acc0),
  351:     make_tests(Ps, N, Acc);
  352: make_tests([], N0, Acc0) ->
  353:     %% Finally, generate some functions with a huge number of clauses.
  354: 
  355:     {Acc1, N1} = make_huge_bsearch(N0, Acc0),
  356:     {Acc, _N} = make_huge_jump_tab(N1, Acc1),
  357: 
  358:     lists:reverse(Acc).
  359: 
  360: make_tests_1(V, N0, Acc0) ->
  361:     {Acc,N} = make_tests_2(V, N0, Acc0),
  362:     make_tests_2(-V, N, Acc).
  363: 
  364: make_tests_2(V, N0, Acc0) ->
  365:     %% Because the values are not consecutive, a binary search will be
  366:     %% generated.
  367:     NumClauses = 14,
  368:     {Acc1,N1} = make_tests_3(V - NumClauses*5, V, NumClauses, 5, N0, Acc0),
  369: 
  370:     %% Test a binary search with 107 values.
  371:     {Acc,N} = make_test("bsearch", V - 5*50, V + 5*56, 5, N1, Acc1),
  372: 
  373:     %% Use consecutive values to allow a jump table to be used.
  374:     make_test("jump_tab", V - 10, V + 10, 1, N, Acc).
  375: 
  376: make_tests_3(_First, _Last, 0, _Step, N, Acc) ->
  377:     {Acc,N};
  378: make_tests_3(First, Last, NumClauses, Step, N0, Acc0) ->
  379:     {Acc,N} = make_test("f", First, Last, Step, N0, Acc0),
  380:     make_tests_3(First+Step, Last+Step, NumClauses-1, Step, N, Acc).
  381: 
  382: make_huge_jump_tab(N, Acc) ->
  383:     NC = 16384 + 1,
  384:     make_test("huge_jump_tab", 0, NC, 1, N, Acc).
  385: 
  386: make_huge_bsearch(N0, Acc) ->
  387:     NC = 2000,
  388: 
  389:     %% Let the last number be a bignum.
  390:     Last = 1 bsl (erlang:system_info(wordsize)*8 - 5),
  391:     Step = 5,
  392: 
  393:     make_test("huge_bsearch", Last - NC*Step, Last, Step, N0, Acc).
  394: 
  395: make_test(Prefix, First, Last, Step, N, Acc) ->
  396:     Name = list_to_atom(Prefix ++ integer_to_list(N)),
  397:     Seq = lists:seq(First, Last, Step),
  398:     L = [{I,erlang:phash2({I,N})} || I <- Seq],
  399:     {[{Name,L}|Acc],N+1}.
  400: 
  401: make_module(Mod, L) ->
  402:     ModDef = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@')."]),
  403:     Fs = make_funcs(L),
  404:     Xs = [{F,1} || {F,_} <- L],
  405:     Exported = [erl_syntax:arity_qualifier(merl:term(N), merl:term(A)) ||
  406:                    {N,A} <- Xs],
  407:     Export = ?Q("-export(['@_Exported'/1])."),
  408:     [ModDef, Export | Fs].
  409: 
  410: make_funcs([{Name,List}|T]) ->
  411:     [make_func(Name, List) | make_funcs(T)];
  412: make_funcs([]) -> [].
  413: 
  414: make_func(Name, List) ->
  415:     Cs = [?Q(["(_@I@) -> _@Body@"]) || {I,Body} <- List],
  416:     erl_syntax:function(erl_syntax:atom(Name), Cs).
  417: 
  418: select_tuple_arity(_Config) ->
  419:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  420: 
  421:     {Vs,Cs} = make_tuple_tests(300, [], []),
  422:     Name = erl_syntax:atom(match_tuple),
  423:     F = erl_syntax:function(Name, Cs),
  424:     Code = ?Q(["-module('@Mod@').\n"
  425:                "-export([match_tuple/1]).\n"]) ++ [F],
  426: 
  427:     merl:compile_and_load(Code, []),
  428: 
  429:     %% %% Uncomment the following line to print the generated code.
  430:     %% merl:print(Code),
  431: 
  432:     verify_tuple_match(Vs, Mod),
  433: 
  434:     %% Clean up.
  435:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  436:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  437: 
  438:     ok.
  439: 
  440: make_tuple_tests(0, Clauses, Acc) ->
  441:     {Acc,Clauses};
  442: make_tuple_tests(Size, Clauses, Acc) ->
  443:     V = erlang:phash2(Size),
  444:     Es = lists:duplicate(Size, erl_syntax:underscore()),
  445:     Tuple = erl_syntax:tuple(Es),
  446:     Value = erl_syntax:integer(V),
  447:     Clause = erl_syntax:clause([Tuple], [], [Value]),
  448:     make_tuple_tests(Size-1, [Clause|Clauses], [{Size,V}|Acc]).
  449: 
  450: verify_tuple_match([{Size,Result}|T], Mod) ->
  451:     Tuple = erlang:make_tuple(Size, a),
  452:     Result = Mod:match_tuple(Tuple),
  453:     verify_tuple_match(T, Mod);
  454: verify_tuple_match([], _) ->
  455:     ok.
  456: 
  457: swap_temp_apply(_Config) ->
  458:     {swap_temp_applied,42} = do_swap_temp_apply(41),
  459:     not_an_integer = do_swap_temp_apply(not_an_integer),
  460:     ok.
  461: 
  462: do_swap_temp_apply(Msg) ->
  463:     case swap_temp_apply_function(Msg) of
  464: 	undefined -> Msg;
  465: 	Type ->
  466: 	    %% The following sequence:
  467: 	    %%   move {x,0} {x,2}
  468: 	    %%   move {y,0} {x,0}
  469: 	    %%   move {x,2} {y,0}
  470: 	    %%   apply 1
  471: 	    %%
  472: 	    %% Would be incorrectly transformed to:
  473: 	    %%   swap {x,0} {y,0}
  474: 	    %%   apply 1
  475: 	    %%
  476: 	    %% ({x,1} is the module, {x,2} the function to be applied).
  477: 	    %%
  478: 	    %% If the instructions are to be transformed, the correct
  479: 	    %% transformation is:
  480: 	    %%
  481: 	    %%   swap_temp {x,0} {y,0} {x,2}
  482: 	    %%   apply 1
  483: 	    Fields = ?MODULE:Type(Msg),
  484: 	    {Type,Fields}
  485:     end.
  486: 
  487: swap_temp_apply_function(Int) when is_integer(Int) ->
  488:     swap_temp_applied;
  489: swap_temp_apply_function(_) ->
  490:     undefined.
  491: 
  492: swap_temp_applied(Int) ->
  493:     Int+1.
  494: 
  495: beam_init_yregs(Config) ->
  496:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  497:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  498:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Mod),
  499:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, [from_asm,no_postopt,binary]),
  500:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code),
  501: 
  502:     _ = [ok = spawn_exec(fun Mod:Mod/0) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 10)],
  503: 
  504:     %% Clean up.
  505:     true = code:delete(Mod),
  506:     false = code:purge(Mod),
  507: 
  508:     ok.
  509: 
  510: %% GH-8433: The register cache wasn't properly maintained for certain helper
  511: %% functions in the ARM JIT.
  512: beam_register_cache(Config) ->
  513:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  514:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  515: 
  516:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Mod),
  517:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, [from_asm,no_postopt,binary]),
  518:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Mod, Code),
  519: 
  520:     try
  521:         ok = Mod:Mod()
  522:     after
  523:         %% Clean up.
  524:         true = code:delete(Mod),
  525:         false = code:purge(Mod)
  526:     end,
  527: 
  528:     ok.
  529: 
  530: %%% Common utilities.
  531: spawn_exec(F) ->
  532:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  533:                                       exit(F())
  534:                               end),
  535:     receive
  536:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Result} -> Result
  537:     end.
